headline: Fractional COO | Business Partner | Board Member | Business Growth Strategist for Real Estate and Franchise Owners | M&A Specialist
summary: As a business owner, you’re often pulled in too many directions, leaving crucial operational challenges on the back burner. That’s where I come in. As a Fractional COO, I step in to solve the pressing problems you don’t have the time to address—whether it’s improving efficiency, reducing turnover, or preparing for major growth. My goal is to take the operational load off your shoulders so you can focus on what matters most: driving your business forward. WHAT IS A FRACTIONAL COO? A Fractional COO is an experienced Chief Operating Officer who works with your business on a part-time or project basis. You get the expertise of a full-time COO without the overhead costs. I step in to manage your operations, streamline your processes, and tackle the day-to-day challenges that you simply don’t have time for. From optimizing systems to improving profitability, I ensure your business runs smoothly so you can focus on growth. HOW I HELP YOU! Operational Problem-Solving: I specialize in taking care of the crucial issues that often get overlooked, from inefficiencies in your business to implementing systems that save time and money. Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A): If you're looking to grow through acquisitions or prepare your business for sale, I provide comprehensive guidance on sourcing deals, managing transactions, and integrating operations. Strategic Growth: Whether scaling a franchise from one to multiple locations or growing market share for real estate brokerages, I create tailored strategies to fuel sustainable growth. WHAT SETS ME APART: I understand that running a business is stressful, and I approach my clients with an empathetic, non-judgmental attitude. My role is not to point out what’s wrong but to work alongside you to find solutions and make your business stronger. I know the pressure you face, and I’m here to help. My background in real estate and franchising means I bring industry-specific expertise, but my unique, people-first approach ensures we build a relationship based on trust and understanding. LET'S CONNECT: If you’re ready to take your business to the next level or simply want to explore how I can help you grow, let’s chat. Feel free to message me here on LinkedIn or email me at guybarretta@thecooguy.com SPECIALTIES: Strategic Planning◘ Project Execution ◘ P&L Analysis ◘ Mergers & Acquisitions ◘ Business Development ◘ Market Analysis ◘ Sales Management ◘ Business Consulting ◘ Strategic Thinking ◘ Team Leadership ◘ Coaching & Mentoring ◘ Process Optimization ◘ Operational Strategy ◘ Revenue Growth

headline: Speaker, Author, Professor, Coach, Faith@Work Strategist
summary: I am a practical strategist, leadership coach, author, and professor working at the intersection of faith and real-world impact. Drawing from experience as a business executive, pastor, educator, and a leading voice in the U.S. faith and work movement, I am passionate to see people fully activated and engaged in their callings, to accelerate and facilitate transformation of leaders and organizations, and for the local church to be equipped to lead people into a biblical understanding of faith, work, and economic wisdom. I was an Area Vice-President with AT&T by age 30, then served as a pastor under Pastor Rick Warren at Saddleback Church where I was the architect and visionary of Saddleback@Work, the workplace ministry. Currently, I am an ICF certified leadership and strategy coach, a professor of ethics, leadership, and strategy at The Crowell School of Business at Biola University, and the Director of the Talbot Center for Faith, Work & Economics where I empower believers to work from biblical principles in all areas of their lives and work with pastors to build organizational competency in the local church to effectively disciple people in their work life. I hold master's degrees in both leadership and theology from Biola University and have studied in the Executive Program at Columbia University. Specialties include: • Executive coaching • Leadership development • Strategic and operational alignment • Ethics • Organizational change and cultural transformation • Employee engagement • Theology of work • Walking out the calling in the marketplace • Women’s leadership and influence • Faith-work integration in the local church • Research on sustainable worklife ministry models for impact • Developing and maintaining workplace small groups

job_title: Faculty - Leadership, Ethics, and Strategic Management Professor
job_description: Shaping and developing leaders, and the next generation in both the masters and undergraduate programs. Teaching Leadership, Change and Innovation; Theology of Leadership; Organizational Business Ethics; and Strategic Management in the Crowell School of Business at Biola University.
company: Biola University Crowell School of Business
company_description: Welcome to the Crowell School of Business where we provide a distinctive approach to business leadership. We call it Business as Ministry. Why is this important? Because business touches every area of contemporary life from the latest products to essential services, and we can’t live without the benefits today’s companies provide. But we regularly read about corporations or even whole industries that seem to stumble from one ethics-related crisis to another. We see failures of leadership at once-trusted brands that cast doubt on pursuing business as a career. Can business be conducted in a way that benefits society, builds profitable and sustainable companies, and is consistent with Christian faith? At the Crowell School of Business our faculty believes that business may be one of the most impactful career choices available for lives of service today. Whether in a public or private company, for profit or non-profit, known brand or entrepreneurial start up, the knowledge and skills you gain at the Crowell School will be valuable for a lifetime of impact. Why are we uniquely positioned to provide this distinctive approach to business leadership? Because the Crowell School faculty along with the other five schools at Biola University take the integration of faith and knowledge seriously as it applies to business, theology, the arts and sciences, humanities and more. Few business schools work so intentionally to pull from various academic and spiritual disciplines to equip students for lives of significance and impact. At Crowell, business education is designed so you learn and put into practice career-relevant business skills while engaging your faith and launching your career. We invite you to learn more about our School and programs by following us on LinkedIn and going to our web page. Or even better: come by and visit us some time!
previous_job_description: Faculty member delivering high level professional coach training to emerging coaches in the School of Leadership.

summary: As the Founder & CEO of Espindola Management Group (EMG), I lead a visionary team dedicated to advancing organizational transformation, workforce development, business leadership, and holistic human development. With over four decades of cross-sector experience—including private, public, and nonprofit—I’m driven by a deep belief in authentic leadership, emotional intelligence, and the power of transformation. headline: Founder OC/Global CEO Collective + SoCal Women in Business | Speaker: Leadership, Innovation, and Mindset | Author, Poets and Dreamers and CEO Journal | Redefining Leadership
summary: Anne Tammel, founder of Global CEO Collective and SoCal Women in Business, is a chief executive advisor and strategy consultant, guiding organizational leaders through cultural transformation, competitive positioning, and strategic growth. Redefining leadership, author of Poets and Dreamers: Thought Leaders and Visionaries and the forthcoming OC CEO Journal, Anne is a public speaker who leads transformative, high-engagement business experiences and CEO masterminds focused on leadership strategy, executive presence, and entrepreneurial mindset. Drawing on decades of experience across Silicon Valley, global corporations, and entrepreneurship, Anne brings clarity, structure, and human-centered strategy to organizations navigating growth and transition. Her advisory background includes executives from Google, YouTube, Microsoft, Citi, Bank of America, Merrill Lynch, EY, PwC, Deloitte, Neiman Marcus, Macy’s, IBM, Baxter, gold-medal Olympian athletes, global nonprofits, founders, and emerging ventures. Having begun her career at the Silicon Valley's leading PR firm, Cunningham Communication, architecting positioning strategy and brand communications frameworks for the most influential leaders in tech, Anne’s philosophy blends Silicon Valley strategy with the USC Marshall ethos of organizational excellence, emotional intelligence, and contemporary leadership design. Drawing from her work as founder of Poets and Dreamers LLC, where Anne developed a positive team culture model for high conflict organizations, Anne now curates and leads high-engagement executive leadership events, CEO roundtables, executive masterminds, leadership retreats, and programs that strengthen cultural identity, elevate executive presence, and unlock collaborative performance. With a Master of Executive Leadership from USC, an MFA in Creative Writing, and as an MBA candidate from USC Marshall, Anne is an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC), an ICF Advanced Certified Team Coach (ACTC), who integrates systems thinking, emotional intelligence, and neuroscience. Recognized by CBS Los Angeles for leading community transformation, Anne leads a regional movement focused on redefining leadership, uniting and elevating women in business, and shaping organizational identity. - Strategic Planning, Growth + CEO Advisory - Leadership Development Programs + Summits - Communications, Positioning + Thought Leadership - Culture Transformation + Organizational Identity - Executive Leadership Strategy - Team Coaching; Collective Performance - Emotional Intelligence; Resilience Development

headline: Managing Partner, Loki Group, Inc. | Executing Corporate Strategy and M&A | Transforming Businesses and Driving Growth | Visionary Leader and Entrepreneur
summary: Alok is a seasoned Executive and Board Advisor specializing in Corporate Strategy as a Service (CSaaS, fractional Chief Strategy Officer), mergers and acquisitions, divestitures, transformation, and deep data analytics. With a track record spanning over two decade, Alok has successfully navigated corporate complexities across many industries, spanning small-cap to enterprise organizations, and in over 15 countries. As the CEO and Founding Managing Partner of Loki Group, Alok is a seasoned professional with extensive experience, including his time with Accenture and Deloitte. Under his leadership, Loki Group has achieved remarkable success, overseeing transactions with a combined value exceeding $125 billion, globally. Alok holds a BS from Georgia Tech (Dean's List) and an MBA from Emory University's Goizueta Business School, where he received the prestigious Meritorious Service Award. Alok's community contributions include serving on the boards of United Way Greater Atlanta and Emory University, as well as being a Board Member Emeritus for Enduring Hearts. Based in Atlanta, GA, he finds fulfillment in quality time with his family and two rescue pups. Alok has had the privilege of being featured on esteemed media organizations such as Yahoo! Finance, Fox News, NBC News, and CBS News. Alok's passion lies in creating enduring value for organizations through operational optimization, cost reduction, and guiding companies to exceed their growth targets. His expertise lies in supporting companies in developing strategic plans, identifying organic and value-creation projects, as well as exploring inorganic opportunities like mergers and acquisitions. —--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Verified by INC: https://www.inc.com/profile/loki-group By requesting to connect with me or accepting my connection request on LinkedIn, you are opting in to be on my distribution list.

headline: Business Strategist | AI Roadmap Builder | Sustainability Maven | Funding Strategist | Technology Futurist | Public Speaker
summary: You know how hard it is to buy fresh food at reasonable prices year-round that hasn’t travelled thousands of miles and arrived at the grocery store still “green”? Nearly 19 million people in the US live in “food deserts”, meaning they don’t live near a grocery store. It’s not just lower-income folks that struggle. Big cities like LA and NY and Chicago have trouble providing fresh food to its citizens. I work with architects, engineers, farmers, and city planners to create buildings that come alive and are a source of food for the people that live there. There tends to be a struggle between architects, engineers, and city planners to develop indoor farms that meet strict building codes, are architecturally attractive, and can grow the foods that people want to eat. Growing thousands of plants indoors with these building restrictions quickly complicate the project. The people that are involved in these projects have specialized knowledge, like a musician in a symphony. They are experts at their instrument and look to the Conductor to provide guidance on when and how to play so that the music is played beautifully for the audience. I’m like the conductor when it comes to these big projects. I can “see” how, when, and where, the players need to bring their specialized knowledge to create the building that grows the food desired by the audience (in this case, the people that live in the city). Conductors know when certain instrument need to play louder, softer, and not at all. As the conductor, I know when to engage the engineers, architects, farmers, city planners and funders. When people work with me, they know they are an integral part of the team and how their role fits into production. More important, they can focus on bringing their specialized skills and talents to the project, free from the stresses of micromanaging components that don’t excite them or detract from what they love working on. What kind of food sustainability projects are you trying to build? I'd love to listen and see how I can support your efforts.

full_name: Luis a. Marrero, ma, rodp, mlp
headline: CEO, Boston Institute for Meaningful Purpose. Igniting the power of meaningful purpose as a force for transformation.
summary: • What is the meaning of life? • You are living life as if what is its meaning? • Do you know why you are here and for what purpose? • How do you measure your life? • Are you satisfied with the quality of your life? It all started with a paradox. Years ago, I went through a difficult period asking myself precisely the questions above. Searching for answers, I discovered that others shared my concerns. As I described it in my first book, I faced a paradox: "Humanity does not suffer from a lack of answers; rather, it suffers despite the answers being available." This paradox became the central quest that led to the start of a new school of psychology: meaningful purpose. Fortunately, I discovered the answers to these existential questions, solved the paradox, and built a practice to help people get the necessary remedies. The point? You, too, can deal with your own paradoxes and benefit by finding the answers to these existential questions. So, if you have big plans and have been giving your all … YET you are struggling with any of the following … • Resistance to your efforts to make a positive difference at work and in social settings. • Lack of Support preventing you from achieving your professional goals and life dreams. • Discouragement from trying to bring to life relationships that should thrive but don't. • Frustration that your contributions are not being acknowledged and appreciated. • Disappointment with people who are indifferent and unresponsive to your contributions, aspirations, and talent. • Exhaustion from investing in long hours at work for little to no appreciation. • Disappointed that your life lacks meaning and direction. But there is hope! The Boston Institute for Meaningful Purpose has something to end the pain. It is called "Meaning Analysis and Improvement." When you harness the "Meaning Analysis and Improvement" method, you will … • Deepen your self-understanding and of your surroundings. • Build your self-confidence. • Discover your strengths and confront your weaknesses courageously for self-improvement. • Discern what other's agendas and their motives are. • Know the "real" root cause of a problem or situation. • Understand what your options are and how to select the most promising one. Check my LinkedIn references to read what some of our happy clients say. I will be happy to meet you through Luis@bostonimp.com and www.bostonimp.com. Boston Institute for Meaningful Purpose. Discovering Life’s Answers.

company_description: The International Positive Psychology Association (IPPA) is a global membership organization of thousands of academics and educators, practitioners and clinicians, students, and others – from over 70 countries worldwide. The field of positive psychology focuses on the study and practice of positive emotions and the strengths and virtues that make all individuals, institutions, and communities thrive. The field has seen hundreds of millions of dollars invested into research, the founding of scientific journals, creation of baccalaureate degrees and masters and Ph.D. programs at universities, TEDx Talks, and reports and cover stories in major news and media outlets worldwide (including Forbes, The Atlantic, The Washington Post, The Guardian, Time Magazine, Parents Magazine, Wall Street Journal, Newsweek, U.S. News & World Report, and more). In addition, award-winning books and publications on both the science and practice of positive psychology have been released through publishing houses including McGraw-Hill, Wiley, Simon & Schuster, Penguin, and others – increasing global exposure and prominence. IPPA's three-part mission is: - To promote the science of positive psychology and its research-based applications. - To facilitate collaboration among researchers, teachers, students, and practitioners of positive psychology around the world and across academic disciplines. - To share the findings of positive psychology with the broadest possible audience. In all of these endeavors, IPPA works to create rigorous standards for positive psychology, so that the field always represents the very best levels of current knowledge. If you share in this mission and vision, we hope you will consider joining us.

Born out of personal experiences with aging parents and a desire to bless our community, we’re building a nonprofit that connects people with resources to help seniors live independently and with dignity. There’s no agenda—just genuine connection, real conversations, and a growing passion to make a difference for older adults and their families. Whether it’s pointing folks toward trusted services, sharing what we’ve learned, or simply showing up with a willing heart, we believe in caring for those who once cared for us.

job_description: When you are a Fortune 500 business unit leader, small business owner, or senior leader of a mid-sized organization, you deal with your share of leadership challenges. How do I manage the politics of my business and organization? What is the best strategic decision to make? How should I restructure the leadership team to put the right people in the right seats? Finally, when I retire, how do I maximize the organizational legacy (not the pompous titles and accolades, but the real change that makes a difference)? My clients know how much I care about building personal relationships and delivering the proper strategic insight at the right time. Caring deeply for my clients and providing a significant impact is the essence of my work. My experience comes from what I’ve learned by overcoming my challenges and building an incredibly successful business, along with working with some of the most successful business leaders in America, Canada and Europe. This history has given me the knowledge and platform needed to inspire my clients to live their values and achieve their destinies. And that’s why I’m so passionate now about using my platform to give others confidence and peace of mind at different stages in their career, working alongside my clients to: • set more explicit goals that are in alignment with their values • refine their understanding of strategy and leadership • leave a functional legacy that is both humble and powerful • achieve a level of success that allows them to give back My work focuses on: Leadership – How are you at influencing others and yourself? Have you clarified your vision and convinced others to help you achieve it? Change Management – New position? Merger? Disruption? Policy change? Do you and your team have to tools to weather change? Teamwork – Do you have the right people in the right place for the job? Strategy – How clear are your personal goals? Team goals? Organizational goals? Are they in alignment?

Jeannetta guides women to dismantle fear-based beliefs, rebuild confidence, and reprogram their thinking for success. Focus: Mindset mastery, resilience, self-worth. 2. This is where vision meets execution — empowering women to lead authentically, innovate boldly, and create ripple effects in business, leadership, and life. Each keynote or workshop delivers immediate mindset shifts and actionable tools that move women from where they are to where they are destined to be. headline: Franchise Matchmaker | I uncover ‘Blue Ocean’ franchises which are highly profitable, easy to set up and help you create financial freedom | Dozens of success stories, will you be next?
summary: I’m Keith Liscio, the Founder and President of Excelsior Franchise Center. My background and experience have uniquely prepared me to serve as a consultant and coach to prospective business owners considering an investment in a franchise system. My mission is to work with clients to winnow thousands of franchises down to a handful of good options, and ultimately the perfect business for them. I grew up in a series of small, family-run businesses – everything from a dry-cleaning shop to a liquor store to a meat market/deli/bakery. After getting a degree in marketing from Villanova University (and later an MBA from the Wharton School) I turned my attention to the corporate world working at Fortune 500 Companies like Procter & Gamble, Nabisco, and Kraft. Eventually, I became an entrepreneur importing ceramics from Italy and then spending almost 20 years running my own Executive Recruiting firm. I was even employed by a couple of franchisees along the way, flipping burgers at McDonald’s in college and working at one of the Midwest’s leading offices for Management Recruiters International. If I’ve learned anything along this journey it’s that running a business is NOT for everybody. Entrepreneurship is even tougher, taking long hours, expertise, commitment, and a high tolerance for risk. That said, business ownership can be incredibly fulfilling and offers many benefits in terms of work/life balance, financial rewards, and tax advantages. Best of all, being your own boss can be great. Really great. For many people, buying a franchise business can be the best way to become a business owner. You’re investing in an established system that’s already successful. You’re in business for yourself, but not by yourself. There are hundreds of options available allowing buyers to choose a business that capitalizes on their strengths and interests while accommodating their preferred working styles. Best of all, I know the GOOD franchises, can save you time and money, and there is no charge for my service. All my fees are paid from the marketing budgets of my franchise partners. If you’re serious about being in business, I can find one that will fit your needs. If you’d like to learn more, schedule some time on my calendar and I’d be happy to answer any questions you might have. Just click here: https://meetings.hubspot.com/keith-liscio

headline: Employee Relationship Capital l Founder, The 20/20 Consulting Group l 2x IPOs (Vignette & Salesforce) l 3x PE/Restructuring (EDS, HPE, BMC) l Change Management l Organizational Network Analysis l US Army Veteran
summary: As a Ranger-qualified and battle-tested US Army officer, I have developed the skill to operate under pressure and lead when ambiguity and chaos replace well-planned strategy and tactics. After a 30+ year career in high-tech, comprised of both start-ups and enterprises, I founded the 20/20 Consulting Group to help leaders operate their organizations. Every organization runs on an invisible operating system => the flow of collaboration, influence, communication, knowledge, and trust that determines how fast work moves and how effectively strategy turns into results. By revealing this hidden system, leaders can see their Employee Relationship Capital: the collective value of employees, and their networks, who accelerate execution, broker trust across silos, and enable influence to flow through relationships that are invisible to org charts. Org design and work can be highly tuned and strategically adapted to fluid, ever-changing conditions. Scenario planning and critical employee decisions are supported by the following: => Which employees are the connectors and bridge builders? => Where does collaboration, communication and influence break down? => Which overly connected employees are at risk of burnout? => Who are the must retain employees? => Who are the sources of innovation and knowledge sharing? => Where do investments in people deliver the highest returns? By measuring how work and information flow, leaders are empowered to make informed decisions on the human side of performance and unlock faster execution and higher economic throughput from the organization they already have. Based in Broomfield, Colorado, I’m a father, coach, and advocate for veteran leadership in business.

job_description: The Forum is an association of local Business Architecture professionals dedicated to understanding, documenting and implementing improvements for Business Architecture. The Twin Cities Business Architecture Forum (TCBAF) is a Minnesota-based organization dedicated to the understanding and advancement of the role and professional practice of business architecture. It exists to promote common definitions and standards, share ideas, and connect like-minded professionals with networking through meetings, activities, presentations, and educational development opportunities at the local level. Founding sponsors of the TCBAF include Express Scripts, Metropolitan State University, Target Corporation, Thrivent Financial, Trissential and other prominent Minneapolis organizations. Bi-monthly two hour meetings are held at a sponsor’s location. Meetings feature a brief presentation followed by a facilitated roundtable discussion – a free flow of ideas is encouraged! There are no dues or membership fees associated with TCBAF at this time.

headline: Revenue Operating Partner to Founders. I fix conversion and help teams close enterprise deals
summary: Most teams I work with don’t have a pipeline problem. They have a decision and conversion problem. Deals stall once they enter the organization. Champions lose momentum. Approvals slow. Revenue looks committed but never actually lands. Founders bring me in when that gap becomes visible and the business needs real revenue movement in the next 30 to 90 days, not another planning cycle. I operate as a Revenue Operating Partner. I work inside live deals, coaching founders and reps where decisions are breaking down, not periodically reviewing dashboards after the fact. Part founder advisor. Part deal strategist. Part GTM architect. How I help: • Diagnose where deals are truly failing: decision ownership, internal alignment, risk tolerance, or economic justification • Coach founders through commercial sequencing, trade-offs, and hard calls that teams avoid making• Work directly inside active deals to equip champions with forwardable, CFO-ready business cases that survive executive scrutiny • Establish a simple operating rhythm that improves deal quality, speed, and predictability without adding process overhead Typical outcomes: • Six- and seven-figure opportunities reactivated after stalling• Material reductions in deal cycle time once decision friction is addressed • Clear internal narratives that unlock approvals without escalation• Founders regaining control of revenue conversations with boards and investors • Improved revenue execution preceding successful acquisitions I’m not a generic founder coach, and I’m not a fractional CRO. Those roles often diagnose problems after the window to act has passed. I specialize in one thing: Turning existing demand into closed revenue by fixing conversion at the point where decisions actually fail. If you’re carrying CEO and CRO responsibilities and deals are slowing inside the funnel, I help you make better revenue decisions and close what’s already on your desk.

headline: Helping SMBs solve their people problems with data and humanity MPO Expert – THE tool to truly understand your people
summary: A while back, I found myself at a crossroads.I wanted my next role to check three key boxes:✔ Work with a leader I respected (or better yet, was inspired by)✔ Be part of a company whose mission excited me✔ Fit into a culture where people actually thrive. Then I realized – finding all three was like looking for a needle in a wheat field.So, I stopped looking and started reflecting. What I really love—the work that fires me up—is helping leaders and teams find their power and perform at their potential. Across my career, whether I was turning around a struggling nonprofit, helping to scale a cybersecurity firm, working on the Olympics, or running my own business, I kept seeing the same issue:➡️ Companies often put good people in leadership roles without the right training or support.➡️ Those leaders struggle, which leads to frustration, turnover, and wasted potential.➡️ The business suffers, and no one wins. But when companies get it right—when they develop strong leaders, put people in roles that fit their strengths, and create a culture where teams perform. That’s where the magic happens.How I Help Today, I partner with CEOs, founders, and leadership teams of mid-size companies to:🔹 Build better leaders – Who inspire, engage, and have the skills to lead.🔹 Put the right people in the right roles – When you play to their strengths, everyone wins.🔹 Create a culture that attracts & keeps top talent – No more revolving door of employees. I do this through leadership coaching, advisory, and fractional executive support, powered by data-driven tools like leadership diagnostics, psychometric assessments, and culture analytics. Leadership isn’t about titles—it’s about unlocking potential. When you get that right, performance, retention, and engagement follow naturally. Curious where to start? If you’re wondering whether your leadership team is aligned or your culture is working for—or against—you, try my quick Leadership Alignment Diagnostic (no cost). It’s a short series of questions that reveals where your biggest opportunities lie.👉 Book a complimentary 20-minute call, or message me “FindMyMana” to start the diagnostic.

company_description: ma·​na (noun) | 1: a generalized, supernatural force or power, which may be concentrated in objects or persons 2: Prestige We all lose it sometimes. Our mind, our rhythm, our flow - our power. Our Mana. Some of us have never found it. Our Mana. We will help you get it back or discover it for the first time! Or sometimes, as the say in the Olympics, we just want to go faster (Citius), higher (Altius), stronger (Fortius). Whatever the case, we get it. Nothing phases us. Start-ups, entrepreneurial ventures, not for profits, big oil, the Olympics, automotive, entertainment, mobile technology, digital media. We’ve been there, done that. We can cut through the noise, and help you focus. We will help you find your Mana. Behind every great athlete, there is at least one great coach and likely a few consultants. Business is no different. We all need a great Coach to help us strategize, strengthen our weakness, and fine-tune our strengths. A sounding board, a thought partner, and on occasion an advisor. Consultants too are critical equipment put in play when specialized resources or additional support are needed. Our Mana is clear, let us help you find yours.

We are a fast-growing professional community committed to fostering human-centric leadership and continuous learning in a rapidly evolving world. I work closely with global and national thought leaders to expand access to high-quality accreditation, raise the visibility of team coaching and coach supervision, and support practitioners in achieving mastery and impact. previous_job_description: I empower senior leaders, C-suite executives, and leadership teams to break free from disconnection and misalignment by guiding them toward authentic fulfillment and sustainable success. As the CEO and Founder of KBP Coaching, I specialize in values alignment, leadership transformation, and systemic team coaching. Drawing from over 2,500 hours of coaching experience, I help leaders and organizations navigate complex transitions such as post-M&A cultural recalibration, leadership shifts, and team cohesion challenges. I created the proprietary bTrue Method and Pyramid of Self-Mastery, designed to help leaders uncover core values, build trust, and align purpose with strategy. My approach strengthens decision-making, improves team dynamics, and drives performance — without sacrificing authenticity. In addition to my coaching work, I serve as President of EMCC USA, driving innovation in coaching standards across the United States. My commitment to helping leaders align their values with their actions has allowed me to partner with Fortune 500 companies, government entities, and dynamic teams worldwide. I believe leadership isn’t about fitting a mold — it’s about uncovering the truth of who you are, stepping into the power of your most authentic self, and leading from that place. Let’s connect to explore how I can support you, your team, or your organization in achieving authentic success.

headline: Build Leaders Who Take Ownership | Leadership Development & Culture Change | 4X Author | USAF Veteran
summary: 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝘆 𝗲𝘅𝗲𝗰𝘂𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘀𝗼𝗹𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗯𝗹𝗲𝗺𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗶𝗿 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗹𝗱 𝗼𝘄𝗻. Margins are tighter. Expectations are higher. And even with capable people around you, you still find yourself stepping in—deciding, fixing, and resolving issues that should never reach your desk. Problems stop getting solved at the right level. Progress slows. And the weight keeps landing on you. Not because your leaders don’t care—but because they haven’t been equipped to take ownership and respond well under pressure at their level. I help organizations build leaders who 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗼𝘄𝗻𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽, 𝗼𝘄𝗻 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘀𝗼𝗹𝘃𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗯𝗹𝗲𝗺𝘀 𝗮𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗿𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗹𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗹—so executives can focus on leading the business, not managing breakdowns. When leaders lead themselves, everything changes. You get a team that: • Owns outcomes instead of escalating issues • Stays steady under pressure • Brings solutions, not problems • Thinks with ownership and perspective Ownership isn’t a personality trait. It’s a skill—and it can be built. I spent 21 years in the U.S. Air Force, where self-leadership wasn’t optional—it was expected. When pressure hit, leaders were trusted to handle what belonged to them. After retiring, I saw the same truth play out everywhere: when leaders don’t lead themselves, someone above them has to. That’s why I built the I Lead Me framework—a practical approach that helps leaders manage pressure, make clear choices, and earn trust where it matters most. previous_job_description: Who We Are: I founded the You Are a GIFT Foundation to help mothers overcome prescription drug addiction and restore wholeness in their lives. After experiencing the personal loss of my daughter, I gained a profound perspective on what truly matters in life. This realization inspired a mission to provide mothers with the education, support, and resources they need to overcome addiction and rebuild their relationships and purpose. The foundation’s name, “GIFT,” reflects our core mission: to help individuals Reflect God’s Image and Fulfill their Talent in service to others. By empowering mothers to heal and thrive, we aim to glorify God through purposeful living. How We Help: At the You Are a GIFT Foundation, we focus on partnering with local organizations and nonprofits to address the unique challenges mothers face on the journey to becoming addiction-free. Through strategic collaborations, we provide: - Access to education and rehabilitation programs. - Tailored solutions to overcome obstacles preventing recovery. - Awareness campaigns to promote addiction prevention and family restoration. Our work is centered on offering a pathway for mothers to rebuild their lives, strengthen their families, and reclaim their purpose. Why We Exist: Prescription drug addiction often leaves mothers struggling to navigate the path to recovery alone. Our foundation exists to fill this gap by partnering with organizations to provide critical support, foster awareness, and pilot funding initiatives. Our ultimate goal is to empower mothers to overcome addiction, rebuild relationships with their families, and live meaningful, purpose-driven lives.

job_description: Founded and lead a national organization that creates and maintains an ecosystem that helps schools and districts recruit, retain, and retire Black male teachers, by cultivating the skills of Black males as early as kindergarten, and coordinating institutional pathways for them to matriculate to and through the profession.
company_description: Black male teachers have shown to have the greatest impact on student achievement. But, they make up only 1.3% of the profession. To shift this, we need an earlier start and longer support. We see today’s Black male students as tomorrow’s Black male teachers. Our goal is for young Black males to discover teaching, then support them at every point on their path to and through the profession. We do this through direct programming and key partnerships. This is The Black Male Teacher Initiative. PreK- High School: In our I AM KING Program (IAK), we train and mentor Black male high school students to deliver social-emotional learning content to younger boys of color. College: Black male college students join our Fellowship in the summer, where they receive instructional support to teach middle school students. Fellows engage in Black male affinity groups during their experience. In the following school year, they have access to additional professional development and networking opportunities, including taking our Introduction to Education, Equity, and Identity course, taught online and accredited by the University of Massachusetts Lowell. He is Me pays for the course! Career: The Black Male Teacher Network is a virtual space for Black male teachers to connect, build community, and engage in identity-based professional development opportunities. Teachers are trained to facilitate affinity groups for their peers, college students, and high school students in our programs. Field-Building: The Building Black Male Teacher Pathways Summit convenes leaders in the education sector to reflect on their initiatives to inspire and support Black male teachers through collaboration. Our lifelong focus provides a clear pathway for Black males to become and remain teachers. As a result of our programs and partnerships, schools will recruit, retain, and retire more Black male teachers.

summary: With 20+ years leading enterprise transformation, I specialize in driving sustainable, technology-enabled change for organizations in financial services, technology, and manufacturing. headline: Culture Strategist & Chief Human Resources Officer | Taking Core Values From The Walls | Transforming Culture & Driving Business Growth | +35% Retention, +25% Productivity
summary: I am a Culture Specialist and Chief Human Resources Officer. I take Core Values off the walls and weave them into the fabric your business. Great companies aren’t built by policies. They’re built by people who believe. And that’s where I come in. I don’t just build HR systems, I build belief. I’ve led culture transformations that have taken organizations from fractured to focused, from toxic to thriving, and from stagnant to scalable. My approach blends data-driven strategy with human-centered leadership because you can’t drive performance without first rebuilding trust. Throughout my career, I’ve been the leader called in to fix what’s broken and rebuild what’s possible. 🔹 At a Fortune 500 Company, I inherited the lowest-performing site in the nation — morale was low, turnover was high, and customer satisfaction was just 18%. Eighteen months later, we achieved 92% satisfaction and cut cycle times from 44 days to 18, outperforming the national average. 🔹 At a private sector company, I built HR infrastructure across eight business units, increasing retention by 35%, productivity by 25%, and reducing benefit costs by 15% — while maintaining 100% audit success. Those outcomes weren’t luck — they came from leadership grounded in three guiding principles: 1️⃣ Listen beyond the words — every voice matters. 2️⃣ Lead with strategy and heart — culture is both compass and engine. 3️⃣ Leave people better than you found them. I’m a People Watcher. A Culture Architect. A Hope Giver. I lead with compassion and excellence — helping executives align business strategy with human potential to drive engagement, retention, and measurable organizational performance. As your next Chief Human Resources Officer or People Culture Executive, I will: 👉 Transform culture into a measurable competitive advantage 👉 Build scalable systems that elevate growth, retention, and accountability 👉 Coach leaders to inspire, not just instruct 👉 Turn your workforce into a unified, purpose-driven community If you’re seeking a leader who can rebuild trust, re-energize teams, and deliver measurable results — let’s connect. Email: rod.querry@gmail.com Phone: (817) 807-3088

headline: Executive Leadership/Career Coach & Consultant
summary: The PSC (People Strategy Consulting) Team I lead provides "Workplace and People Solutions". I also serve as a Leadership/Career Coach for other consulting firms. We serve companies of all sizes, in service, manufacturing, educationand non-profit organizations to optimize their greatest asset ---their People! Partnering with our clients, we do this by selecting the best talent with cutting edge selection tools and processes, and then coach, train and develop this talent to provide their top performance that maximizes business results in a very positive, constructive work culture. Our PSC Team's expertise can help your company by: Coaching & Developing Leaders & Key Associates: Individual coaching for emerging, developing and strategic leaders, as well as, key individual contributors, in one of two ways: (1) One-on-one with a designated professional coach for a 3-9 month period, where a leadership development plan is created and implemented, or (2) by "Just-in-Time" Coaching allowing a leader to obtain a one time or multiple coaching session and support from a professional coach on a "as needed and confidential basis" for a specific issue or situation. Developing High Performance Teams and Engaging Employees: A customized Team Coaching process over a series of Team sessions is developed based upon issues and concerns the team has, as well as to address any Team dysfunctions, which all teams must overcome! Focus is on team relationships, team tasks and goals, individual accountability and a plan of action is developed and implemented. Keeping People in the Know: A plan is developed to engage the hearts and minds of your people through internal communications that inspires trust and secures commitment. Tools and ideas to help leaders in their role of enhancing communications is a major focus, as well as alternative ways to provide messages and engage all employees. Developing the Blueprint for the Future: At the organizational level, the PSC Team can help your company survive turbulent times and strategically plan for the next phase of your company’s growth. This is done by facilitating strategic planning sessions to align your company's vision, mission, people and processes, to achieve organizational goals. We also help companies create a "positive company culture" or enhance their current culture, implement change initiatives, and develop succession management processes to assure on-going leadership for the future.

headline: Owner, Speaker, Life Coach, Corporate Wellness Consultant, TEDx speaker
summary: I bring mental and emotional education to the workplace and teach on the topics of identifying and managing stress, setting and enforcing boundaries and creating clear communication. headline: Leadership Reinvention Strategist | Helping Capable Leaders Operate at Strategic Altitude as the Leadership Game Changes | Author, The Delegation Cure™
summary: Most capable leaders don’t struggle because they lack skill. They struggle because the leadership game they’re winning no longer scales. At a certain point, what made you successful still works but it starts creating friction. - Execution slows. - Decisions pile up. - Effort increases, but impact doesn’t compound the way it used to. That moment is an inflection point. - Nothing is broken. - Performance is strong. - But the rules of the game have changed. Most leaders respond by working harder inside the old game. That usually makes things worse. 📍I work with capable leaders and executive teams at these inflection points when growth requires a different leadership game. My work focuses on helping leaders recognize: 🔸 when they’ve outgrown the game they’re playing 🔸 where their leadership model no longer fits the level of complexity 🔸 and how to update how they think, decide, and operate together so execution regains clarity, speed, and resilience This is not a performance problem. It’s not a motivation issue. It’s a leadership operating system mismatch. Where I Focus I work upstream of burnout, reorgs, and stalled execution, helping leaders shift from: • Expert leadership → system-level leadership Designing decision architecture instead of personally solving problems • Alignment by effort → alignment by design Reducing coordination friction and decision latency across teams and stakeholders • Heroic contribution → scalable impact Ensuring leadership effort converts into strategic outcomes, not exhaustion Background 20+ years of experience across Asia, Europe, and the Americas, working in complex, global environments where leadership scale and system design matter. Former global talent and organizational development leader in Fortune 500 contexts, with deep experience advising senior leaders navigating growth, complexity, and reinvention. That same discernment and discipline now underpin my work with leaders at inflection points. How We Work at Potentia My work begins with diagnosis and focuses on system-level change, not heroic effort. • Leadership Operating System Diagnostic Brief (entry point) • Leadership OS Intelligence Mapping (by invitation) • Reinvention OS Lab (system-level execution upgrade) You don’t need to simplify your environment. You need a leadership system built for it. 📧 nsage@potentia.cc 🌐 potentialeadership.com

headline: As an Integrator, I Help Founders Escape the Prison You Built While Striving for Freedom: I Bring People, Process, & Structure Together to Make YOUR Cell Phone Stop Ringing and YOUR Bank Account Start Singing | NetWeaver
summary: You didn’t start your business to run every department. You had a vision. You saw a better way to serve customers, lead people, and grow something meaningful. But somewhere along the way, you became the bottleneck. You’re stuck in the weeds. Solving problems you didn’t cause. Approving decisions you shouldn’t have to make. Every new hire or process adds complexity, not clarity. That’s where I come in. I help Visionaries like you build real businesses, not high-paying jobs. As a Fractional Integrator and COO, I step in as your Second-in-Command. I bring structure to the chaos, create clarity around roles, and build systems that keep your team moving forward without constant input from you. I’ve spent 25+ years doing this across industries: tech, telecom, construction, service, distribution, and several others. I’ve led teams as an VP of Operations, Integrator, President, and COO. Today, I work with companies between $2M and $50M who are scaling fast and feeling the pressure. Most are running on EOS® and have an Implementer™ or graduated from one. Here’s how we work together: 1. Clarify the structure – Clarify your Accountability Chart so everyone knows who owns what. 2. Install discipline – Use tools like scorecards, Rocks, and Meeting Rhythms that actually get traction. 3. Free you to lead – Remove you from day-to-day ops so you can stay in your zone of genius. When the right operational structure is in place, everything changes. You get your time back. Your team gets aligned. And your business becomes something you can grow, scale, or even sell. Let’s turn your company into the business you originally set out to build. Based in Fairhope, AL - Available Nationwide

headline: Strategic Partner at How We Won • ICF MCC in 2026 🏃🏻‍♀️🎯
summary: Fourteen years ago, I relearned how to walk. That experience is the foundation of my work today. It taught me what it truly takes to perform under max pressure. Now, I partner with organizations to help their people and teams in high-stakes, dynamic environments become totally unshakeable. My journey started during my recovery when I discovered a passion for the human side of performance. This led me to a stint in journalism, covering the inner workings of Major League Baseball player development for NPR. Being on the ground gave me a deep understanding of the complexity, ambiguity and risk that leaders and staff in pro sports and entertainment face every day. Then I launched my own practice, How We Won. Now I serve as the long-term strategic partner to talent at organizations in the most demanding industries, helping them build the personal and team resiliency to create winning leadership and cultures. I've delivered over 4,500 sessions to employees at top companies like Google, American Express and Warner Bros. Discovery. I’m an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC), Master Certified Coach (MCC) candidate, and QE Executive Certified Coach (ECC). I also have a B.S. in Psychology. I believe an individual's personal strength and health are the most important drivers of an organization’s success. “Kim is more than a coach. She's a strategic partner. She has a unique ability to help you peel back the layers of complex, multi-faceted challenges until you find the core issue. I went into our work feeling overwhelmed and left with a profound sense of clarity and peace. She doesn't just help you solve problems. She helps you see that you were never broken to begin with.” - VP, Global Partnerships at a Fortune 100 Company My services are optimized for organizational needs and include: Trainings, Workshops and Coaching (Executive, Team, Leadership, Onboarding, Career Path, Shadowing).

Are you lacking a pipeline of quality leaders ready to address future business challenges? Is your senior leadership team failing to achieve excellent results? These are the challenges Decatur Street Consulting helps our clients solve. Hi, I'm Andy Noon, PhD, and I founded Decatur Street Consulting to help make leadership a critical advantage for every organization. After 20+ years of building programs that identify, select, develop, and accelerate leadership, I've learned that the true differentiator of organizational excellence is extraordinary leadership. With the exponential age upon us, the value of extraordinary leadership will be even more evident. If leadership is important to you and your organization, Decatur Street Consulting can help you with: • Evaluating and selecting quality leaders • Customized leadership development and executive coaching • Senior leadership team building and development • Executive succession planning and high-potential identification

headline: Founder at VirtueWorks, LLC | Fractional Consultant | Mindstyle Coach at The LOVELY Project
summary: If you're reading this, you're curious. Curious people are intelligent people. I thrive on curiousity. My summary used to be the same-old rote descriptions of all the things I thought I was. It included words like "strategic", "collaborator", "leadership-driven", "people-centric", and so on… I AM all those things but what about the PERSON behind the ROLE? Where did she go, I wonder? Well, a COMPLETE burnout in HR during the pandemic and two, yes two, subsequent layoffs in two years, I'm finally free of the constraints our modern workplace norms have become. I would now describe myself as a former Human Resource professional who woke up one day and had enough of the games, the politicking, working the grind for someone else only to be a cog in the wheel. It became untenable. I was reminded that we really can only control the "controllables"... ... how we respond to change, the integrity with which we handle ourselves, how we manage our home & finances, how we take care of and love those who we love, and ultimately where/when/how we steward the gifts and time we've been given. Jobs will come and go but who you are in the in-between matters most. I recently read a famous quote that made my stomach turn and my pulse race ..."The majority of people die at 35 but aren't buried until 75" - I see what this represents all around me and have my whole career. People on autopilot, no self-reflecting, not thriving, not clear on their God-given purpose and direction. I believe God wants better for you and for me. You have a LOVELY calling ... ready to discover what that is? Follow my journey: The Making of Something Lovely @ www.lovelycalling.com

headline: Business Consulting | People & Culture Strategy | Leadership & Team Development | Facilitation & Coaching | Fractional HR | Speaker
summary: I’m an Organizational & People Strategy consultant who partners with founders, leaders, and teams to build the systems, behaviors, and cultures that support sustainable, human-centered growth. After more than two decades in People & Culture and HR leadership roles — from start-ups to public companies — I shifted my work to focus on what I’m most passionate about: helping organizations strengthen their foundations, develop purposeful leaders and teams, and navigate growth with clarity and intention. I support clients through strategic consulting, leadership and team development, facilitation, coaching, advisory work, and, when needed, fractional support. My work often centers around: • Organizational, business & culture strategy • Leadership, team & culture development • People systems and foundational HR infrastructure • Performance & feedback frameworks • Coaching, facilitation & talent development • Employee experience & engagement My approach blends strategy with humanity and is shaped by several practical and research-backed frameworks. I use the Five Facets of Business™ to help leaders look holistically at their organization, and I integrate principles from Appreciative Inquiry and Intentional Change Theory into my leadership and team development work as I continue expanding my practice in these areas. I complement this with behavioral tools such as Tilt365, DISC, Motivators, and The Six Working Geniuses to support self-awareness, communication, and effective collaboration across teams. I frequently work with early-stage and growth-minded organizations, particularly in tech and professional services, while remaining open to meaningful work in new environments. 🤝 I partner best with leaders who value clarity, collaboration, and intentional growth. ✨ Certified in Tilt365, DISC, Motivators & multiple leadership development tools 🎓 Pursuing a Master’s in Leadership & Organizational Change (CWRU) 🎤 Available for speaking, workshops, coaching, consulting, advisory, and fractional engagements 📩 Let’s connect if you’re navigating growth, culture, or leadership transitions.

headline: Executive Coach: Leadership, Transitions & Teams | Adviser | Former Johnson & Johnson HR Executive
summary: Carol is a transformative executive coach, strategic advisor and consultant whose 30+ year career has been defined by an unwavering commitment to helping people, teams and organizations unlock their fullest potential. She has a rare blend of operational acumen, cultural intelligence, and instinct for transformation and turns complex ideas into actionable insights, asking tough and helpful questions, and creating positive environments where dialogue drives progress. Carol has navigated complexity of large-scale change, leading with empathy, clarity and a result-oriented mindset. She has led, mentored and sponsored thousands of diverse leaders and teams as they faced into and progressed successfully through change. With a professional foundation laid at Johnson & Johnson, Carol served in multiple VP, Human Resources/Management Board roles in Pharmaceuticals, Consumer Products, and Medical Technology. She provided trusted counsel to leaders in and across Commercial, R&D, Supply Chain, and Corporate functions. Carol built/led high performing, diverse HR teams in Business Partner and Specialist roles including Global Leadership Development and D&I. Carol is President of New Hope Coaching where she partners with individuals, professional service providers and global, large/mid-scale companies in Pharmaceuticals, Biotech, Consumer, Retail, Manufacturing, and Provider/Delivery. She is curious, learns quickly, and is interested in new business segments. Carol delivers 1:1 executive coaching for Presidents, /S-VPs, and Sr. Directors in an array of discipline areas, in addition to executive leadership team advising/consulting. M.S. in Organizational Development from American University/NTL Certified: Board Certified Coach (BCC), Center for Executive Coaching, CEC Team Coaching, Hogan Leadership Assessments, Prosci Change Management Carol thrives on meaningful connections with family, friends, and colleagues, loves animals, enjoys discovering new places, meeting new people, and playing a fun round of golf. Her belief in the power of people, the promise of potential and the beauty of possibility is not just a mission statement – it’s how she lives, leads and inspires others.

headline: Helping B2B leaders accelerate & de-risk organic growth while delivering results from new business, innovation and transformation. Let's make an impact!
summary: A recognized B2B growth expert and coach, I help B2B leaders accelerate & de-risk growth through strategic market innovation. CONTACT ME for a complimentary consultation at 216.333.4569 or Kelly@LawrenceInnovation.com. I'm the one people call to deliver new business growth. I strive for continuous learning, so it's an honor to serve as a contributing author to WhatTheyThink, an AIM Institute coach and Innoquest community member. I've enjoyed the learning that has come from authoring globally recognized market reports and working with global teams over the years. I am thrilled to share insights with others who share the vision of improving organic growth processes and results. When you choose to work with me, you gain a partner who cares about growing your business just as much as you do. Specializing in strategic market innovation, my boutique advisory firm helps B2B leaders de-risk and accelerate organic growth for long-term sustainable business results. My approach is recognized for delivering value-driven partnerships and measurable ROI. I am humbled that my clients who collectively represent over $120 billion in annual revenue, partner with me to solve real-world problems that make a significant impact. ORGANIC GROWTH EXPERTISE From initial market assessment through demand creation, I help you analyze your unique situation and develop practical action plans to accelerate organic growth. I also help teams build stronger competency in front-end-of innovation processes for higher hit rates. Before founding Lawrence Innovation, I delivered impactful innovation results at Fortune Brands' Moen and Berkshire Hathaway's Lubrizol. My teams typically have a hit rate upwards of 60% versus industry averages of under 5%. What would it do for you if you could improve your hit rate by 10x? MY VISION Walt Disney said, "If you dream it, you can do it." I say, of course you can, but make sure it matters to your customers before you build it. MAKING IT MATTER Passionate about making the world a better place, I live and play in Greater Cleveland, Ohio with my husband and two daughters - my why. I relish learning new things. Hobbies include traveling, standup paddle boarding, hiking with my pal Zeke (English Black Labrador), baking, & reading.

headline: Fractional CMO | Business Growth Advisor | Business Coach | Strategy & Marketing Expert | Helping Professional Services & Consumer Brands Scale, Differentiate & Win
summary: As a strategic advisor, coach, and consultant, I help business owners, founders, and managing partners simplify complexity, create clarity, and drive sustainable growth. I work with professional service firms, consumer product brands, manufacturing businesses, construction companies, and technology firms to develop and implement actionable strategies that fuel revenue growth, enhance profitability, and build high-performing teams. WHY MY EXPERIENCE MATTERS TO YOUR BUSINESS: I spent my career leading marketing, sales, and business development for well-known consumer brands and manufacturing firms. While my expertise began in consumer-driven industries, the principles of growth, positioning, and strategy apply universally and are just as critical for professional service firms as they are for consumer brands. Professional service firms struggle with differentiation, client acquisition, and scaling. Consumer brands focus on creating emotional connections, brand loyalty, and effective go-to-market strategies. My expertise blends both, helping professional service firms apply consumer-driven insights to win more business while guiding consumer brands to develop lasting market impact. HOW I HELP: ✔ Growth Strategy & Positioning – Establishing a compelling market position that drives demand and revenue. ✔ Leadership & Team Optimization – Helping owners develop leadership skills, structure strong teams, and build a results-driven culture. ✔ Sales & Marketing Acceleration – Driving lead generation, conversion, and long-term customer engagement. ✔ Business Efficiency & Financial Strategy – Identifying key operational efficiencies to improve profitability and scale effectively. ✔ Exit & Transition Planning – Preparing businesses for leadership transitions, mergers, or sales to maximize value. REAL RESULTS, REAL IMPACT: ✅ Transformed professional service firms by refining messaging, improving operations, and increasing client acquisition. ✅ Led go-to-market strategies that drove multimillion-dollar growth for national and global consumer brands. ✅ Revitalized declining industries through strategic branding and marketing that increased market share and profitability. ✅ Helped business owners scale and exit by positioning their companies for sustainable growth and maximum valuation. LET'S CONNECT: I work with business owners through coaching, consulting, and fractional executive support. If you’re looking for an experienced partner to unlock the next level of growth, let’s start a conversation.

headline: Executive Coach ♦ Leadership Team Coach ♦ Speaker and Facilitator ♦ Non-Profit Board Leader and Founder
summary: I'm Kat, a Finnish-American ICF-certified executive and leadership team coach, facilitator, and speaker with 25+ years of experience in global organizational and leadership development. I help leaders and organizations create a culture of inclusion and psychological safety where innovation thrives. My master’s degree in Mental Health Counseling informs my holistic, research-backed coaching framework. Together, we explore new perspectives and identify solutions for growth and success as well as health and well-being. In 1998, I moved from my native Finland to New York City. I was the first in my family to earn a college degree and, like many others, I craved the energy, inspiration, and diversity of life in NYC. I held career services and HR & development roles before founding my independent coaching practice. My expertise lies in international and highly-demanding professional contexts—since founding my practice, my work has taken me to Helsinki, Rome, Bangkok, and Bonn and I’ve worked with leaders based across six continents. Sisu—the Finnish concept of resilience—and my own personal experiences as an immigrant have deeply influenced my coaching philosophy. My approach to coaching is built upon a core belief in our human capacity to learn and grow, to succeed through challenges, and live and lead with purpose. Alongside my coaching practice, I am an experienced senior non-profit founder and board leader. I have founded, led, and developed several global and local non-profit community organizations over the past 30 years. After I moved to NYC, I founded two non-profit organizations with and for Nordic women. I have served as vice-president for a global non-profit FIGT.org, and the local Finnish American Chamber of Commerce in NYC. I led the Chatham High School Marching Band Club, a registered 501c3, as President for several years. As a leader, I am driven by my values to make a difference by strengthening communities through engagement. In all my leadership experiences, I have improved the performance and structure of the board—I am a skilled organizer known for getting things done. I lead with a strong vision and clear goals while building engagement and motivation through communication and relationship building. Want to learn more about working with me as your executive or team coach and facilitator? Send me a note!

summary: I am passionate about helping businesses bring their product visions to life. As the founder of InterConcept Inc. and Mennä Life, I have guided numerous businesses through the complexities of sourcing, design, and production, ensuring they have high-quality products that resonate with their target audience. From concept development and private labeling to global sourcing and manufacturing logistics, I provide comprehensive solutions that make the entire process seamless. I ensure that every step of the process—from sourcing materials to final production—is handled with precision and care, providing you with peace of mind that your product is being developed efficiently and to the highest standards. Whether you're an emerging startup looking to develop your first product or an established brand seeking to expand your line, I offer the expertise, network, and strategic insight needed to deliver results. In addition to my product development work, I am also a certified life coach specializing in energy healing. I teach individuals how to access their inner world of energy awareness and use this awareness to self-discover their outer material world. If you're not using energy consciously, you're only living with half of yourself. My coaching empowers clients to live fully, aligning their personal and professional lives for lasting balance and fulfillment. Let’s work together to create something extraordinary for your brand. Reach out today to discuss how I can support your product development journey or personal growth.

Everyone has unique abilities, interests, and talents, but sometimes it’s hard to recognize them within ourselves. My coaching process focuses on aligning your goals with your true purpose, starting from within. I also integrate energy healing and somatic stress release techniques into my coaching to help you not only navigate life’s changes but to improve your relationships, deepen your spiritual connection, and increase your presence, happiness, and impact in the world. Together, we’ll clear away the noise and pressure of outside expectations, so you can gain clarity on how you truly want your life to feel. Whether you’re seeking to shift the direction of your life, break free from self-sabotage, or heal your relationship with your body, we’ll peel back the layers and rebuild for a stronger, more joyful life. My mission is to make energy work and higher awareness accessible to everyone—so we can let go of unnecessary conflict and pain and embrace lives of passion, purpose, and true fulfillment. headline: Helping leaders make clear strategic decisions amid rapid change and uncertainty | Strategy & AI Adoption Consultant | TEDx Speaker | Host of The Generalist Advantage podcast
summary: Strategy breaks down when conditions change faster than plans. I help leaders and organizations navigate complexity when the path forward isn’t fully visible — strengthening judgment, sense-making, and decision-making as the terrain shifts. My work sits at the intersection of strategy, leadership, and human judgment. I support organizations facing high-stakes decisions shaped by uncertainty, competing priorities, organizational change, and rapid technology shifts — including AI. Through 8Ball Clarity, I work with leadership teams on strategic clarity, decision-making, and alignment when execution alone isn’t the problem. My role is to slow thinking down just enough to create clarity — and then help people move forward with confidence. As a Fractional Chief Strategy Officer with Scarlett Nova, I help organizations move from AI curiosity to responsible, value-creating adoption. This includes shaping AI strategy, governance, and decision frameworks that account for human readiness, risk, timing, and system-level impact — not just tools. I’m an engineer-turned-people executive and strategist, with experience spanning manufacturing, supply chain, enterprise risk, digital transformation, and organizational development. I’m industry-agnostic by design, enabling cross-pollination of insight across systems. I also host The Generalist Advantage podcast because the world needs more of their superpowers. What clients value most: ✅ Clearer decisions in complex situations ✅ Stronger alignment across diverse stakeholders ✅ Momentum without oversimplifying reality Fluent in English and French. Generalist by nature. Strategist by practice. Deep believer that good judgment is the most underdeveloped capability of our time. Random fact: my passport proudly displays stamps from 40+ countries. 🌎 Talk to me about #Strategy #AIAdoption #criticalthinking #Generalists

headline: When psychology drives up to 90% of success, the smartest move is upgrading it. We optimize your leaders’ internal source code so growth, clarity, and performance skyrocket: CEO of True North Radical Resilience
summary: With a doctorate in clinical psychology and extensive studies, experience, and practice in corporate coaching and consultancy, Dr. Andy Garrett is at the forefront of a revolutionary movement towards personal growth and optimization. He earned his doctoral degree from the Graduate Psychology program at Azusa Pacific University. Their theoretical emphasis on Systems theory and unique holistic integration philosophy helped him to become very effective in conceptualizing and implementing strategic growth plans for individuals, families, and corporations. Dr. Andy uniquely emphasizes a positive psychology approach that utilizes established individual, familial, and organizational strengths rather than underscoring what may be pathological or dysfunctional. In blending this approach with a systems theoretical model, existential psychology, and solution-focused strategies, he's empowered to provide a transformative brand of coaching and consulting. Throughout his career, he’s contributed a significant and meaningful role as a consultant for multiple faith-based organizations - where he specializes in empowering his clients to discover and establish their True North identity, purpose, and community - and then integrate radically resilient principles, practices, and strategies - that enable his clients to consistently achieve their biggest goals and actualize their greatest potential. Dr. Andy has made a considerable impact working as a performance coach for high performing executives, elite athletes, and organizations throughout Southern California - and beyond (his online coaching curriculum has been effectively utilized and taught throughout the US - and even in select European countries). Dr. Andy has developed a thriving private practice in the renowned Newport Beach area, and he offers custom private workshops, corporate training programs, he is a highly sought after speaker and podcast guest, and he continues to offer concierge style coaching services (although - openings with Dr. Andy are rare to come by - so, if you are interested in working with him one on one - you should get on his waiting list ASAP!).

My mission is simple: make business education clear, actionable, and inspiring so entrepreneurs can thrive. Through webinars, workshops, and one-on-one advising, I share lessons I’ve learned from running my own businesses—what works, what doesn’t, and how to keep moving forward no matter what challenges come your way. Core Skills I Help Business Owners Master: • Creating practical business plans • Pricing products/services profitably and understanding break-even points • Marketing using free and low-cost tools (online and offline) • Cash flow forecasting and financial management • Time management, goal setting, and building systems • Hiring, training, and motivating small teams Popular Workshops & Programs: • Financials for Non-Financial Small Business Owners • Low-Cost Marketing Tools to Grow Your Business • Create a Business Plan That Gets Results • Profitably Price Your Products + Break-Even Analysis • One-Page Business Model and Marketing Plan • Recruit, Train, and Motivate Your Team Flagship Program: How to Run Your Own Business (5-Day Course) This hands-on course covers: • Business modeling, planning, and funding • Bookkeeping, taxes, and financial statements • Marketing and PR strategies • Operations and systems • Real-world stories that motivate and inspire I work closely with small business enterprise centres, economic development agencies, and government programs to deliver practical, results-driven training that makes a real impact. Let’s connect if: ✔ You support small businesses and want to collaborate ✔ You're looking for training programs for entrepreneurs in your region ✔ You believe in making business education simple and empowering

job_description: Self Employment Training Program for Small & Medium Enterprises BizLaunch has developed an exclusive small business training program for the self employed or for those interested in starting their own business. The program includes: • Mentorship and coaching • Inspiring stories from experienced business owners • Networking opportunities • Training Program Benefits for Attendees The training program comes with a multitude of benefits for attendees: • Consists of 10 live workshops which are relevant and inspirational. • All workshops are recorded for attendees to catch up on if they miss a session. • Attendees will learn the A-Z of running a successful business. • Free resources, financial and planning templates and course materials are provided. • All sessions are presented by experienced small business owners. • Attendees are entitled to ongoing business coaching via telephone and/or Google Hangouts with their trainers. What attendees will learn: • What it takes to become a successful small business owner. • How to create a business model. • How to develop a business plan. • How to develop a cash flow forecast. • How to improve your cash flow. • How to price and cost your products or services. • How to calculate your ideal profit margin and break-even point. • Marketing and sales that works. • How to develop a marketing plan. • The basics of income tax. • Manage your bookkeeping and accounts. • Relevant business legalities. • How to get free publicity for your business. • How to analyse and interpret financial statements. • How to develop systems to manage your business & time management. • People management and how to put processes in place to protect you and your staff. • How to network effectively online and offline. • Business success secrets. • Online marketing. • Social media management. • Selling products online.
